questions.prompt: In which settings is undernutrition during the first 1000 days of life most prevalent?

options.C: Only regions affected by armed conflict

questions.rationale: Undernutrition in the first 1000 days of life is most common in low- and middle-income countries.

questions.prompt: Which outcome would a community health worker most likely associate with malnutrition in children aged five years and under?

options.A: Increased susceptibility to infections and impaired development
options.C: Improved cognitive performance in later childhood

questions.rationale: Malnutrition in young children is associated with increased infection risk, impaired physical and cognitive development, and increased mortality.

questions.prompt: When monitoring growth in a child under two years of age, which approach is most appropriate?

options.A: Use WHO Growth Standard Charts and assess growth using serial measurements over time
options.B: Use growth charts designed for older children and rely on a single measurement
options.C: Plot measurements without regard to age-specific standards
options.D: Delay growth monitoring until the child reaches two years of age

questions.rationale: WHO Growth Standard Charts are recommended for children from birth to two years, and serial measurements over time are needed to assess growth patterns.
